column4: Hi! When I search for Skype on Ubuntu Software Center I am told there are two versions of Skype available, both called "Skype:i386". I wonder why there are two of them and neither of them is marked as already installed on my system. (Ubuntu 11.10 and Skype already installed)
maybe you have two repos who have the same software in it? Try apt-get purge skype, then apt-get install skype
i'll check it out. where am i supposed to find my repos? are those the same i found in my /etc/apt/sources.list?
yes. Paste it to pastebin and paste the link here
here is the content of my sources.list along with a brief summary of my problem
here is the content of my sources.list along with a brief summary of my problem http://pastebin.com/JtpVwv58
try apt-get update
I already tried with apt-get update
I tried purging and reinstalling Skype with apt-get, it seems it's now retrieving 2.2.0.35-0oneiric2 version
it's weird apt-cache policy didn't mention anything about this oneiric version before the purge
thanks
what's the output after apt-get install skype?
what output? policy?
yes
try "locate / -iname 'skype'", post the output without permission errors to pastebin. Do you have the bin?
locate? do you mean "find"?
just check if you have the bin in "/usr/bin"
it's there
so it is installed but it doesn't show on package list as installed?
skype was installed and is currently installed after the purge/reinstall. the problem is some sort of (apparent) inconsistency between apt-get and ubuntu software center
restart ubuntu software center. Maybe you should report a bug
at the end of the day ubuntu software center realizes skype is installed but two same versions of skype are found
ok i will
